Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Past Surgical History: Prior surgeries for HVAY, 69TM, B2AU, 08Q8.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Past Surgical History: Prior surgeries for NO4T, UR3E, EIOI, OUYL.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

History of Present Illness: Caroline Carpenter is a 58-year-old female with N9KAOX who presented to the emergency department with acute onset pain that began 5 hours prior to arrival. Pain was rated 5/10. The patient reports the pain has been persistent since onset. The patient took aspirin (500 mg) at home with minimal relief. Genetic Screening: Patient carries alleles KG95, M348, 4Y2Y, DLY7, AQSO, Y5DA, YARD, 4UHM. Family History: MELA, PQK1, 34M8, FJ21, QANL, LYBI. Medications: 9R1 50 mg/day. Past Surgical History: Prior surgeries for YHWN, YHLI, AUPU, VIKC.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Past Surgical History: Prior surgeries for V7DC, 0153, GOF8, DAPJ.

The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.

Causal context: Chronic disease N9KAOX sometimes requires surgical intervention, depending on genetics, patient history, vital signs, and lab results. The patient will experience significant pain (rated greater than or equal to 8/10) if they carry allele GT81, a genetic marker for severe N9KAOX. If the patient self-reports significant pain or the patient carries allele KG95, then vital RJS8 will be low (less than 0.25 mg/dL). If the patient self-reports significant pain or RJS8 is low or the patient has a family history of MELA, then lab TTW1 will be elevated (greater than 1.2 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or the patient carries allele M348, then vital OT3C will be elevated (greater than 2.97 mg/dL). If TTW1 is elevated or OT3C is elevated or the patient carries allele 4Y2Y, then lab OVYI will be low (less than 2.28 mg/dL). If OVYI is low or the patient carries allele DLY7, then vital PF2V will be low (less than 1.63 mg/dL). If OVYI is low and PF2V is low and the patient has a family history of PQK1, then the surgeon will recommend surgery. Assume that all factors influencing the surgeon are fully described here.
